cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / developing Tropical Storm
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles NNW of Cozumel, Mexico and 505 miles SW of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning northeast across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and expected to cross South-Central Florida on Saturday before emerging into the Atlantic and accelerating northeastward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida Peninsula (likely somewhere between Naples on the west coast and Fort Lauderdale on the east coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County line (including Port Everglades) and the west coast south of the Middle of Longboat Key, plus the Florida Keys and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and southeastern Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, and adjacent Gulf and Atlantic coastal waters
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (11% cumulative chance, peak gusts around 40 mph) late Friday night through Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the southeast Florida coast south of Card Sound Bridge; less than 3 ft expected near Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches could cause considerable flash and urban flooding in South Florida, including the Port Everglades area Friday through Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions and elevated seas for port approaches; potential localized coastal flooding at high tide.
